fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2025e2.equipments.solar_panel.mil

Interface SolarPanelSimulationConfigurationI


  • public interface SolarPanelSimulationConfigurationI
    The interface SolarPanelSimulationConfigurationI defines configuration parameters for the solar panel simulator.

    Description

    Invariants

     invariant       MeasurementUnit.AMPERES.equals(ElectricMeterImplementationI.POWER_UNIT)
 invariant       TIME_UNIT != null
 invariant       LATITUDE != null
 invariant       LONGITUDE != null
 invariant       ZONE != null
 invariant       (LATITUDE, LONGITUDE) in ZONE
 invariant       ORIENTATION >= 0.0 && ORIENTATION <= 360.0
 invariant       SLOPE >= 0.0 && SLOPE <= 90.0
 invariant       NB_SQUARE_METERS > 0

    Created on : 2025-10-02

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DETERMINISTIC_SUNRISE_HOUR
      when using the deterministic sunrise and sunset model, the hour of sunrise each day.
      static int DETERMINISTIC_SUNSET_HOUR
      when using the deterministic sunrise and sunset model, the hour of sunset each day.
      static SolarPanelEventI.Position LATITUDE
      latitude of the solar panel.
      static SolarPanelEventI.Position LONGITUDE
      longitude of the solar panel.
      static int NB_SQUARE_METERS
      available number of square meters of solar panel.
      static double ORIENTATION
      Sun azimuth from the solar panel, in degrees, north-based; this is the direction along the horizon, measured from north to east (or example, 0.0 means north, 135.0 means southeast, 270.0 means west.
      static double SLOPE
      slope of the solar panel.
      static java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit TIME_UNIT
      time unit used in the solar panel simulator.
      static boolean USE_ASTRONOMICAL_MODEL
      when true, use the astronomical version of the sunrise and sunset model, otherwise use the deterministic version.
      static boolean USE_STOCHASTIC_SUN_INTENSITY_MODEL
      when true, use the stochastic version of the sun intensity model, otherwise use the deterministic version.
      static java.time.ZoneId ZONE
      time zone of the solar panel.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static double deterministicSunIntensityCoef(java.time.Instant current)
      provide a deterministic simulated value for the sun intensity using a the sine of the daylight from sunrise to sunset mapped to the interval [0; Math.PI].
      static java.lang.String extractDateString(java.time.Instant i)
      extract the date from the standard format of an Instant.
      static java.time.Instant getSunrise(java.time.Instant current)
      return the Instant of the sunrise at DETERMINISTIC_SUNRISE_HOUR the same day as current.
      static java.time.Instant getSunset(java.time.Instant current)
      return the Instant of the sunset at DETERMINISTIC_SUNSET_HOUR the same day as current.
      static boolean sameDate(java.time.Instant i1, java.time.Instant i2)
      return true if i1 has the same date as i2.
      static boolean staticInvariants()
      return true if the static invariants are observed, false otherwise.

      • getSunrise

        static java.time.Instant getSunrise(java.time.Instant current)
        return the Instant of the sunrise at DETERMINISTIC_SUNRISE_HOUR the same day as current.

        Contract

         pre     current != null
 post    current.get(ChronoField.YEAR) == return.get(ChronoField.YEAR)
 post    ChronoField.MONTH_OF_YEAR) == return.get(ChronoField.MONTH_OF_YEAR)
 post    current.get(ChronoField.DAY_OF_MONTH) == return.get(ChronoField.DAY_OF_MONTH)
        Parameters:
        current - some instant in a simulation.
        Returns:
        the Instant of the sunrise at DETERMINISTIC_SUNRISE_HOUR the same day as current.

      • deterministicSunIntensityCoef

        static double deterministicSunIntensityCoef(java.time.Instant current)
        provide a deterministic simulated value for the sun intensity using a the sine of the daylight from sunrise to sunset mapped to the interval [0; Math.PI].

        Contract

         pre     current != null
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        current - some instant during the simulation.
        Returns:
        the sun intensity coefficient for current.
